User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the CipherChat application.

email.description: The email address of the user.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a chat message within CipherChat.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat message.

senderId.description: Reference to the User who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatMessage)

recipientId.description: Reference to the User who is the recipient of the message. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatMessage)

scrambledMessage.description: The scrambled version of the message.

timestamp.description: The date and time when the message was sent.

scrambleMethod.description: The scrambling method used for this message (e.g., letter substitution, reverse).

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Only the authenticated user can read/write their own profile. Includes standard profile information (username, email).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user.  Matches request.auth.uid.

definition.description: Stores chat messages for a specific user. Only the sender and recipient (defined by senderId and recipientId fields) can read/write messages.  The path `/users/{userId}` denotes the user that has access. Security rules will ensure that either request.auth.uid == resource.data.senderId OR request.auth.uid == resource.data.recipientId. Requires a composite index on `senderId` and `recipientId`.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user who either sent or received the message. Must match either `senderId` or `recipientId` in the message data.

params.name: messageId
params.description: The unique identifier for the chat message.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure and scalable solution for the CipherChat application, focusing on private user data and messaging. The key principle is Authorization Independence, achieved through path-based ownership and avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. Data is segregated to ensure each collection has a homogeneous security posture, simplifying rules and improving maintainability. 

Users are stored at the `/users/{userId}` path, ensuring only the authenticated user can access their data.  Messages are stored within a subcollection `/users/{userId}/messages/{messageId}`. This structure enables straightforward security rules based on path ownership, ensuring that only the sender and recipient have access to a message's content.

This design supports the QAPs (Rules are not Filters) by ensuring that `list` operations can be securely performed within the `/users/{userId}/messages` collection, as access is determined by path-based ownership.
